title: Global Macro Indicators For January 2021
text: US Dollar is likely to continue to depreciate. Commodities are likely to continue to rise.

title: TD Securities Sees Potential for U.S. Dollar Bounce
text: Jan.03 -- Mitul Kotecha, senior emerging markets strategist at TD Securities, discusses the outlook for the dollar, Asian currencies and bitcoin. He speaks with Rishaad Salamat and Haslinda Amin on "Bloomberg Markets: Asia.

title: 2021: A Potentially Turbulent Year Ahead
text: 2021 is going to be a difficult year for investors. Geopolitical developments will influence the global economy.

title: Precious Metals Royalty And Streaming Companies: The December Report
text: The Precious Metals R&S Index declined by 0.07% in December. The Precious Metals R&S Equally Weighted Index increased by 9.05%.

title: There Aren't Enough Earnings For The High P/E Stocks. Short The Bubble
text: I collected P/E data on the 563 big cap ($10+ billion) companies listed on the NYSE and NASDAQ. 104 of these companies have P/E ratios north of 50, including 53 with 100+ P/E's.

title: The Fed: Fed has been successful at convincing markets it will be more dovish down the road, Bernanke says
text: The Federal Reserve's new policy framework and commitments have been effective at convincing markets the central bank will be more dovish for years to come, said former Fed chairman Ben Bernanke on Sunday.

title: U.S. stock futures flat as 2021 trading kicks off
text: U.S. stock-market futures opened flat late Sunday, in the first trading session of the new year.

title: Stock futures open flat as Wall Street kicks off the new year
text: U.S. stock futures opened along the flatline on Sunday night ahead of the first session of 2021 following a volatile year of trading.

title: Stocks and bitcoin are massive bubbles, long-time bear David Rosenberg warns
text: Rosenberg Research's David Rosenberg is worried about frothiness in the market, but he's still finding ways to make money.

title: Economists expect tough sledding in winter, then a rebound
text: Economists believe that a number of factors will help fuel a spending resurgence later in the year.

title: 2020 Portfolio Review: What a Year
text: Without a doubt, 2020 will be a year few will ever forget. A global pandemic upended normal life for so many people.

title: Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq advanced in 2020 and surged to record highs
text: The U.S. stock market advanced in 2020, and Wall Street's three main indexes surged to record highs last week. The main reason for this is that investors hope that a fiscal stimulus and coronavirus vaccines will drive a robust economic recovery in 2021.

title: Week Ahead - Focus On Georgia Senate Races And COVID Holiday Surge
text: The week ahead is all about COVID, the Georgia Senate runoff races, and possibly a negative nonfarm payroll reading. The main economic data event of the week will be the December nonfarm payroll report.

title: 10 Remarkable Financial Events Of 2020
text: In looking back at the extremes of 2020, the following events in global financial markets helped make this year one for the books. Uncertainty about the policy response to Covid-19 initiated the cascade of financial market extremes, but expansionary monetary policy was a profound accelerant as lockdowns took hold.

title: Economic outlook 2021: The market is underestimating economic growth: Strategist
text: #2021GDP #2021economy #YahooFinance Yahoo Finance's Brian Sozzi, Julie Hyman, and Myles Udland break down the market action with Baird PWM Market Strategist, Michael Antonelli. This segment originally aired on December 29, 2020.

title: IPOs: A red-hot year for tech offerings shows deep economic disparities
text: In a year when large swaths of the economy sputtered due the pandemic, Wall Street opened its doors to new entrants with 218 companies raising  $78 billion through initial public offerings.

title: Saying goodbye to a wild year for stocks
text: We're hoping to shelve the word 'unprecedented' for a while as 2021 gets underway — but first, one final look at a 2020.

title: Sentiment Speaks: A Review Of A Wild 2020 And Looking Forward To A Bullish 2021
text: 2020 was the most challenging and profitable year of my career. The news certainly had many looking the wrong way for most of 2020.

title: 10 Reasons the Stock Market Could Crash in 2021
text: A new year doesn't mean stock market volatility is going to disappear.

title: Overconfidence Meets Impatience To Set Up The Crash Of 2021
text: The latest clue that we're in yet another bubble is margin debt. When margin debt peaks, so, frequently, does the market.

title: Final Jobless Claims Of 2020 Continue To Show A Lack Of Progress
text: New jobless claims are still significantly above their recent pandemic lows. Continuing claims, seasonally adjusted, once again made a new pandemic low.
